overview: This measure establishes a single, system-wide University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund, repealing the separate funds for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community Colleges (HB1169_SD1). It directs that all appropriations and encumbrances from the previous funds be lapsed into the new, consolidated fund (HB1169_SD1). The intent is to standardize conference center program administration across all campuses and eliminate redundant statutes (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_).
agency_impact: The University of Hawaiâ€˜i System reiterated its support for the measure in testimony before the Senate Committee on Higher Education, stating the new fund structure would mirror other successful system-wide funds (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This administrative change is expected to streamline operations by allowing all campuses to use a single overarching fund with individual campus accounts (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The consolidation will eliminate the need for unnecessarily duplicative statutes for separate revolving funds (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_).
policy_impact: The measure has advanced to the Senate, where the Committee on Higher Education has recommended that it pass Second Reading and be referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1). The bill was amended to make it effective upon approval and to include technical, nonsubstantive changes for clarity and consistency (HB1169_SD1). This action signifies continued legislative momentum for consolidating the university's conference center funds (HB1169_SD1).
revenue_sources: The newly created University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund will be funded by transferring all appropriations and encumbrances from the two funds it repeals: the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_SD1). No new revenue sources are established by this measure. The fund will continue to be supported by revenues generated by conference center programs.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the measure's legislative progress into the Senate, where the Committee on Higher Education has amended it and recommended it for referral to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1). A key amendment sets the bill's effective date to upon approval (HB1169_SD1). Committee reports now explicitly state that the measure repeals two existing revolving funds and transfers their balances, providing greater clarity on the consolidation process (HB1169_SD1).
